purpose.summary: A visual node-based IDE for designing, training, and tuning GENREG (Genetic Regulatory) AI models
purpose.description: Genome Studio provides a LiteGraph-based interface to construct and visualize AI architectures that combine evolutionary algorithms with regulatory protein networks. The system uses Snake as a testbed environment, but the architecture is designed to be environment-agnostic for future applications.
goals: Visualize AI model architecture as connected node graphs
Real-time monitoring of training metrics (trust, fitness, population stats)
Interactive parameter tuning without code changes
Separation of regulatory layer (proteins) from functional layer (controller)

frontend.role: Visual graph editor, monitoring, user control

genreg_model.concept: Two-layer AI architecture inspired by biological gene regulation

regulatory.name: Protein Network
regulatory.purpose: Process environmental signals into trust modifiers

functional.name: Controller Network
functional.purpose: Select actions based on input signals
functional.architecture: Feed-forward neural network (11 inputs -> 16 hidden -> 4 outputs)

evolution.mutation: Gaussian noise on weights and protein parameters

steps: 1. Genome Builder creates population of N genomes
2. Episode Runner starts episode for genome[0]
8. When snake dies, Episode Runner finalizes, advances to next genome
9. After all genomes evaluated, Generation Manager triggers evolution
10. New population feeds back to Genome Builder, repeat

future_plans: Support for multiple environment types beyond Snake
More protein types for complex regulatory networks
